src:
Bajernov novi početak
Bavarci protiv Olimpijakosa prvi put sa novim trenerom Hansom Flikom, koji je prelazno rešenje posle smene Nika Kovača

06 Nov 2019

Kriza Bavaraca donosi neizvesnost. S maksimalnih devet bodova iz tri kola Bajern dočekuje Olimpijakos koji ima samo jedan bod, ali niko nije siguran šta će se desiti večeras u Minhenu u okviru 4. kola Grupe B Lige šampiona (18.55). U bilo kojim drugim okolnostima, Bajern bi bio apsolutni favorit i upisao bi laganu pobedu.
Međutim, sada su okolnosti specifične. Bavarski gigant je za vikend doživeo debakl u Frankfurtu i ekspresno je smenio trenera Nika Kovača. Ne dešava se često Bajernu da smenjuje kormilara posle tri meseca od starta sezone, ali Hrvatu je ta omča već dugo visila i bilo je pitanje trenutka.
Ekipa je uzdrmana teškim porazom od Ajntrahta i smenom trenera. Iako nije imao dobar odnos s pojedinim starosedeocima poput Boatenga i Milera, Kovač se održavao dobrim rezultatima. Međutim, ove sezone je u Bundesligi krenulo po zlu i morao je da ode.
Ekipu je uoči meča protiv Olimpijakosa preuzeo dosadašnji pomoćnik Hans Flik. On će sigurno voditi ekipu u ovom meču i protiv Borusije Dortmund za vikend, a dotad bi klupska uprava trebalo da iskristališe trajno rešenje. Neke šanse da ostane se daju i Fliku. Uz ubedljivu pobredu protiv Olimpijakosa i dobar rezultat protiv Borusije, Flikove akcije bi skočile i mogao bi da dobije šansu do kraja sezone.
Zato treba očekivati maksimalno ozbiljan i motivisan Bajern. Neki igrači će se verovatno potruditi i da dokažu Kovaču da je grešio. Bajern bi pobedom obezbedio plasman u osminu finala, ali bi ubedljivom pobedom napumpao poljuljano samopouzdanje. Grci su autsajderi, a ni oni ne dolaze u baš dobrom raspoloženju. Za vikend su upisali kiks protiv Ksantija, a trener Pedro Martins je pod sve većim pritiskom.

LIGA ŠAMPIONA, GRUPNA FAZA - 4. KOLO

text:
Bayern's new beginning
Bavarians against Olympiakos for the first time with new coach Hans Flick, a transitional solution after Nick Kovac's dismissal

06 Nov 2019

The Bavarian crisis brings uncertainty. With a maximum of nine points from three rounds, Bayern are greeted by Olympiakos who has only one point, but no one is sure what will happen tonight in Munich in the Group B Champions League Round 4 (18.55). In any other circumstance, Bayern would be an absolute favorite and would have scored an easy win.
However, the circumstances are specific now. The Bavarian giant experienced a debacle in Frankfurt over the weekend and dismissed coach Nick Kovac expressly. It is not often Bayern that he changes his helm after three months from the start of the season, but to the Croat that noose has long hung and it was a matter of time.
The team is shaken by the heavy defeat of Eintracht and the change of coach. Although he did not have a good relationship with some Indigenous peoples like Boateng and Miller, Kovac maintained good results. However, this season the Bundesliga went wrong and had to leave.
The team has been taken over by former assistant Hans Flik ahead of the match against Olympiakos. He will certainly lead the team in this match against Borussia Dortmund over the weekend, and by then the club management should be able to crystallize a lasting solution. Some chances to stay are also given to Flick. With a convincing win against Olympiacos and a good result against Borussia, Flick's actions would jump and he could get a chance by the end of the season.
Therefore, we should expect the most serious and motivated Bayern. Some players will probably do their best to prove to Kovac that he was wrong. Bayern would secure a place in the eighth finals with a victory, but with a convincing victory it would inflate their confidence. The Greeks are outsiders, and they are not in a good mood either. On the weekend, they registered a kickoff against Xanthi, and coach Pedro Martins is under increasing pressure.
